comments.body: The trailing slashes are no longer needed.

For example, this cluster has cluster-level logging enabled (using Elasticsearch), which can be reached

comments.body: You need to have a '/' as the end due to a bug in our system. Can you please try following the steps to make sure they work for you?
I thought the trailing / issue was resolved (per issue 7502)? But can add them back in if its still a bug.
Have you tried it? Does the access to Elasticsearch without the final slash work for you?

Im not sure but I assumed it wouldnt because my build still shows v1beta1 (i assumed my build didnt pick up the fixes yet). Ill try (and also check to see if there is a new image available for me to install).

This is what I get i.e. the trailing slash is needed. Why are you seeing v1beta1? Perhaps you can check out the latest build from HEAD and run that?

```
$ curl -k -H "Authorization: Bearer XXX" https://130.211.115.179/api/v1beta3/proxy/namespaces/default/services/elasticsearch-logging
$ curl -k -H "Authorization: Bearer XXX" https://130.211.115.179/api/v1beta3/proxy/namespaces/default/services/elasticsearch-logging/
{
  "status" : 200,
  "name" : "Tommy",
  "cluster_name" : "kubernetes-logging",
  "version" : {
    "number" : "1.5.2",
    "build_hash" : "62ff9868b4c8a0c45860bebb259e21980778ab1c",
    "build_timestamp" : "2015-04-27T09:21:06Z",
    "build_snapshot" : false,
    "lucene_version" : "4.10.4"
  },
  "tagline" : "You Know, for Search"
}
```

Ok updated k8s to .17 (latest binary) and also found/received the same results (the trailing slash / is still needed). Since 'kubectl cluster-info' excludes the forwardslashes, ill add back in the statement about ensuring it gets added.

```
rescarez@rescarez:~/kubernetes$ cluster/kubectl.sh cluster-info
Kubernetes master is running at https://199.223.233.175
elasticsearch-logging is running at https://199.223.233.175/api/v1beta3/proxy/namespaces/default/services/elasticsearch-logging
kibana-logging is running at https://199.223.233.175/api/v1beta3/proxy/namespaces/default/services/kibana-logging
kube-dns is running at https://199.223.233.175/api/v1beta3/proxy/namespaces/default/services/kube-dns
```
